content.description: The right most line of bolts on the east face of the South American boulders. Using the boulder for the start to get established on the face and clip the first bolt is considered on (traversing in from the top of the boulder is Little Soldier, 12a). Sustained crimping on sharp edges that generally become more comfortable higher on the route. Route gets great afternoon shade.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Easy access to set a TR.

content.description: This climb is a short layback dihedral on the South American Boulders.  At only 30' in length, it is short but is strenuous for the grade.

Overhung fist to offwidth boulder. Hardest part is pulling over the edge. 

  Hope you know how to invert!
content.protection: #4 as high as you can place it from the start, then larger pro once you pull over the lip. You should only need two pieces. No anchors.
content.location: Giant split boulder to the left of the South American boulders on Freshman Mountain. You really can't miss it.

climbs.name: Northeast Arete Right of Amazon Boulder

content.description: Moves up the Arete on the North face of the Amazon Boulder.  Powerful arete mixed with delicate face  moves.
content.protection: Top rope on awkwardly placed bolts on top.  Must lead the West face of the Amazon Boulder to access these bolts and set up the route.
content.location: Right side of the Northeast arete.  Must lower off top-rope.  Must clean and rap from two large bolts for the Amazon West Face.

climbs.name: Northeast Arete Left of Amazon Boulder

content.description: The East face of the Amazon Boulder using the Northeast arete.  More strenuous the the right arete.
content.protection: Top rope using existing bolts on top.  Access by leading the West face of the Amazon Boulder
content.location: West face of the Amazon Boulder along the Northeast arete.

content.description: Starts on the right side of the crack that splits the Eastern face of the South American Boulder.  Clip the 2nd bolt of Welcome to Bootcamp or place gear in the crack for protection.  Traverse this crack out to the 3rd bolt of Welcome to Bootcamp and finish on Welcome to Bootcamp.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a possible piece placement in the crack.  Two large bolts on top as an anchor.
content.location: Eastern face of South American Boulder

content.description: Start in the overhanging crack and grovel your way up past the bulge to easier climbing. I can't find this climb in any guidebooks, so if anyone knows of a prior ascent, let me know so I can update this.
content.protection: Hand to fist cams. No anchors.
content.location: West face of Freshman Mountain, 100 yards uphill from Rock Clark Wall. Look for a hand crack with a cave at the base and a couple boulders in front of it. Downclimb the slab to the climbers right for the descent. Be careful as some of the rock is rotten.

content.description: Currently this is the hardest graded route at Enchanted Rock.  The route is on the Arete on the left side of the Eastern face of South American Boulder.  It is to the far left of Welcome Bootcamp.  4 bolts on the face and two rings on top as anchors.  Very high and dangerous first bolt.  Usually this first bolt is clipped before starting.  The PG13 is in the case that it is attempted without clipping the first bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts on the face and two rings on top as anchors.
content.location: Eastern face of South American Boulder.  On the other side of the boulder from South American crack.  On the Southern most part of Freshman Mountain.

content.description: The North face of the Amazon Boulder. Moves up the right side and up the middle of the face without using the Arete.
content.protection: Top Rope.  Two fixed awkwardly placed bolts on top.
content.location: North (uphill) side of the Amazon Boulder.

content.description: Climb the steep, western face of the Amazon Boulder on incut crimps. A really fun, interesting climb that is worth the hike.
content.location: The western face of the very tall, free standing boulder on the southern side of Freshman Mountain. Just downhill from the South American Crack.

content.description: A group of boulders located at the southeast corner of freshman mountain. Most climbs are down the valley at the Amazon Boulder, with a few climbs scattered in the boulders upstream. Home to such classics as South American Crack and Amazon Boulder.
